description.narrative: The British Council delivers science, technology, engineering and mathematics aligned programmes in the Higher Education sector in South Africa on behalf of the Newton Fund since 2016.

The British Council in South Africa partners with the Department of Higher Education & Training and the National Research Foundation, the research funding agency for the Department of Science and Innovation. This programme supports 24 of the 26 publicly funded universities.

To strengthen academic staff development and capacity building through training and mobility opportunities that support the development of an inclusive pipeline of future academics in South Africa with a particular focus on women in South Africa's 26 publicly funded universities. To support early career and leading researchers to establish new international collaborations. Researchers and higher education institutions exchange ideas bilaterally (United Kingdom and South Africa) and trilaterally (United Kingdom, South Africa and a third African, for example Kenya). The thematic focus areas for collaborations include food security, higher education, climate change and the circular economy.
Young academics; young scientists; early career researchers; established researchers.
